synopsis.p: Reads files and adds a document in the corpus for each file.

description.p: reads file(s) from and creates a document in the corpus for each file. The identifier of the created document is the absolute path of the corresponding file. The created document has a single section named whose contents is the contents of the corresponding file.

If is a path to a file, then will read this file. If is a path to a directory, then will read the files in this directory. If is set to true, then the files in sub-directories will be read recursively. only reads files whose name match . If is not set, then reads all files.

If is set, then creates a new document for each set of lines. For instance, if is set to 10 and a file contains 25 lines, then 3 documents are created: two containing 10 lines and one containing the las 5 lines.
Files are read using the same encoding .
The created documents will all have the features defined in . The unique section will have the features defined in .

param-doc.name: constantDocumentFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each document created by this module

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: This expression is evaluated as a boolean with the corpus as the context element, the module will process the document only if the result is true.

param-doc.name: charset
param-doc.p: Character set of the input files.

param-doc.name: constantSectionFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each section created by this module

param-doc.name: linesLimit
param-doc.p: Maximum number of lines per document.

param-doc.name: sourcePath
param-doc.p: Path to the source directory or source file.

param-doc.name: sectionName
param-doc.p: Name of the single section containing the whole contents of a file.

param-doc.name: sizeLimit
param-doc.p: Maximum number of characters per document. No limit if not set.

param-doc.name: baseNameId
param-doc.p: Use the filename base name instead of the full path as document identifier.

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.
